Description: Fragment from one end of a plain weave cloth; mainly undyed, warp-faced plain weave linen; six rows of supplementary weft (4.5 cm wide, 67.5 cm long) in purple wool (S/c.4 threads to a row); plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/13), weft-undyed linen (S/9); supplementary weft threads grouped (3 picks) every one cm; where brocaded the groups of wool bind over 6, under 1, over 1 under 1 etc; one simple selvedge, one warp fringe and other edges cut; possible furnishing
Curator's comments: with circle label with inv. no. one side (6823a) in yellow and 56, 5, 14, 22 in a cross formation. possibly acquired 1856.
